author: 大公报
title: ﻿全民國家安全教育日2025/參訪京滬歸來港生對國安增使命感
text:
上圖：42名本港中小學生，以前往北京及上海參訪與交流的經歷為背景，表演了舞台情景短劇《學子心 祖國情》。左下圖：六名參演舞台劇的學生，向大公報記者分享在參訪團的所見所感。右下圖：不少同學第一次參演舞台劇，綵排時十分認真和投入。
　　4月15日是全民國家安全教育日，香港特區維護國家安全委員會舉辦了「全民國家安全教育日」開幕典禮暨主題講座。42名參加了第二屆「國家安全教育參訪團」的本港中小學生，以前往北京及上海參訪交流的經歷為背景，表演了舞台情景短劇《學子心 祖國情》。
　　六名參演學生接受大公報記者訪問，分享參訪團所見所感，以及台前幕後的趣事，表達了香港年輕一代對國家發展的正面認知和主動維護國家安全的堅定決心。\大公報記者 陸九如（文） 麥潤田（圖） 融媒組（視頻）
　　「參加國家安全參訪團令我對國家近代史產生了更全面的認識。」就讀港島民生書院的陳卓謙表示，赴內地學習的行程涵蓋很多地方，以往從沒經歷過。他參加了國安宣講會，還看到天安門廣場升旗儀式。陳卓謙在中國共產黨歷史展覽館看到許多傳奇人物的事跡，讓他了解到新中國成立時，千千萬萬先輩所作出的努力和犧牲，「這樣的精神值得香港年輕人學習。」作為首次參演短劇的同學，陳卓謙指開闊了視野，未來會從自己做起，並將體驗和經驗分享給同學，幫助大家培養國家安全的意識和國民身份認同。
　　敬仰錢學森無私奉獻精神
　　就讀福建中學高二年級的胡聞韜十分珍惜去人民大會堂參觀，在觀禮台上看升旗儀式的寶貴經驗。「我認為黨史館將歷史的厚重感和現代的科技感完美結合，通過多媒體互動，將黨和國家的發展脈絡呈現給同學們。」胡聞韜在短劇中飾演錢學森一角。被問到如何呈現「中國航天之父」這一重要角色時，他表示通過了解錢學森生平，觀看紀錄片和媒體介紹等，深入理解錢學森排除萬難，毅然決然回國發展航天事業的心路歷程。「錢老的事跡完美體現了熱愛祖國、無私奉獻的兩彈一星精神。」胡聞韜還指，錢學森曾說：「外國人可以做的，怎麼中國人就不行。」這讓他明白只要下定決心，毅然走下去，就一定會成功。
　　瑪利諾修院學校（中學部）許雅妍分享，行程中觀看升旗禮，清楚地看到三軍儀仗隊的英姿，看到全場莊嚴肅立唱國歌，一股愛國情懷油然而生。「我覺得自己對國家安全肩負了更大的使命。」許雅妍說，她在參訪團後還報名參加青年國安大使的培訓計劃，「希望有機會去做國安展覽館的義務導賞員。」許雅妍透露，參訪團後對基本法、憲法、國家安全法等法律產生濃厚興趣，希望未來能成為一名律師。「台上一分鐘，台下十年功。」許雅妍分享說，本次短劇表演提高團隊凝聚力、自信心和溝通能力。
　　朱晁陞就讀於聖公會李兆強小學，首次到訪北京，首都的繁華留下非常深刻印象。在行程中，他最難忘參觀清華大學，「那裏的大哥哥大姐姐都很厲害，而且很謙虛」，令他萌生日後去該校讀書的想法。他亦對國家航天發展很感興趣，希望日後從事守護國家安全、回饋社會的職業。他說，許多同學首次參加話劇，綵排過程中發生很多趣事，「這是大家值得一起學習的寶貴經驗。」
　　 現今安穩生活 先輩用生命鑄造
　　就讀於順德聯誼總會胡少渠紀念小學的邵梓謙，在劇中飾演與小紅軍對話的小學生，他認為現今人們安穩生活是先輩們用自己的生命鑄造的，所以更應該珍惜。此次參訪團令他印象最深刻的是參觀中關村第三小學的校園，以及和當地的同學進行交流。
　　在劇中飾演其中一位小紅軍的是來自中華傳道會安柱中學的張浩榮，他告訴記者，平時比較開朗，但扮演小紅軍需保持嚴肅。「紅軍長征是中國共產黨歷史上一項偉大的壯舉，他們為人民的幸福不惜自我犧牲的精神令人動容。」他過往認為，只要國家不被侵犯，自身利益無損，就算國家安全。但在參訪團結束後，他知道國家安全包括許多範疇，與人民生活息息相關，國家的穩定需要共同維護。張浩榮說，參觀航天城讓他了解到國家最新的科技發展，認識到包括導航系統、國防在內的航天科技是國家安全的重要組成部分，他認為新時代的年輕人，應積極為祖國的科技事業貢獻力量。

author: Grady Glover NonStop Local Photog/Multimedia Journalist
title: Dog stolen on Christmas from woman under porch reunited with owners | News | khq.com
text:
HAYDEN, Idaho - A dog stolen in north Idaho on Christmas has been found in eastern Washington. Just two days ago, Liberty Lake police located and returned Jack, the Cairn Terrier, to his owner, according to Lynn Pehrson, the animal's owner. Pehrson also added that getting the dog back would not have been possible without the support he felt from the community.
"I started out as an army of one and turned into an army of a thousand and ten thousand in a matter of hours," Pehrson said.
According to Pehrson, an anonymous source was staying at the Best Western in Liberty Lake when they saw a dog that looked like one he had seen on a missing dog poster. This man then called Pehrson's daughter, who confirmed the dog he was looking at was in fact, Jack. Lynn Pehrson then went to the hotel and, with help from the police, was able to get the dog back from the woman who stole him, who Pehrson says is the dog's previous owner.
Pehrson's daughter had bought the dog from the woman on Facebook marketplace for $400 four years ago.
Between a woman who stopped in the middle of the road to call 911 after the dog was stolen, to the anonymous caller who first saw Jack in Liberty Lake, and even to a veterinarian who stayed open late so they could confirm Jack's identity, the entire community stepped up to lend a helping hand.
"It breathes life for believing and bringing faith back into man, and back into the common man. And were helping one another and looking out for one another. And that's what it's about. Thank you," said Pehrson.
Jack was a little shaken up at first when he returned home with the family, but has adjusted to being the dog the Pehrson knows and loves.
The Pehrson's hope that justice is served in the case of their stolen dog, but are moving forward as a reunited family.

author: Ruetir
title: SP: weekend has rain and hail, says Civil Defense
text:
This Friday (1), the Civil Defense of the State of São Paulo issued a warning of moderate rain during this Friday (1) in some municipalities, which may continue in the next few hours.
The precipitation, according to the agency, is due to the heat that hit the region during the day and the humidity that comes from the ocean and the Amazon towards the Southeast, generating instability in certain areas of São Paulo, with the possibility of moderate rain.
The state institution’s Emergency Management Center (CGE) sent alerts to residents of the north, northwest, center-west and Vale do Paraíba regions of São Paulo.
Anyone registered in the alert system via SMS 40199 (find out more about this at the end of the report) received a message informing them of the upcoming rain, including lightning and hail.
Rain, strong winds, lightning and thunder: weather has changed (Image: Daniel Tadevosyan/Shutterstock)
“Our radars identified rain cells in some regions of the state, with moderate intensity, including winds that could cause some damage,” said São Paulo Civil Defense meteorologist, Cleber Souza.
By night, there is a chance of rain in the west of the state, as intense instability is forming in Mato Grosso do Sul and could move to São Paulo.
“We need to continue monitoring minute by minute to observe the behavior of this rain that forms in Mato Grosso and what its potential will be when it arrives in São Paulo”, continued Souza.
Read more:
How to protect yourself in case of rain or storms In the event of storms or catastrophes, follow the following Civil Defense safety guidelines:
Avoid open places, such as beaches, football fields and parking lots; Avoid being close to tall and isolated objects, such as trees, poles, water tanks and kiosks; When it rains, keep away from appliances and objects connected to the electrical network, such as refrigerators, stoves and TVs; Avoid bathing during the storm; In case of strong winds, be careful with falling trees, poles, wires and traffic lights; Do not challenge the force of the water, do not try to overcome a flood or walk through flooded areas; If you are in a hillside area, watch for signs of ground movement, such as cracks in walls, leaning trees and posts, and muddy water; If a live wire falls on your vehicle, stay inside your car and call emergency services.
Only some regions of the State of São Paulo will be affected (Image: Cris Faga/Shutterstock)
How do I register for the Civil Defense alert system? To start receiving storm alerts and other relevant information from Civil Defense, send an SMS with your zip code to number 40199, or send a message to the agency’s WhatsApp, number (61) 2034-4611.

author: Ayesha Mumtaz
title: Norway Approves GMO Canola Oil in Aquaculture: A Leap Towards Sustainable Fish Farming
text:
In a landmark decision on February 15, 2024, Norway has given the green light to the introduction of genetically modified (GMO) canola oil in its aquaculture industry. This move, aimed at addressing the dual challenges of dwindling wild fish stocks and escalating fish oil prices, marks a significant pivot towards sustainable fish farming practices. The GMO canola oil, known as NS-B50027-4, is engineered to contain omega-3 fatty acids, essential for the health and growth of farmed salmon, and to enhance the fish's color and nutritional value.
The Drive Towards Sustainability
The Norwegian Food Safety Authority's approval of NS-B50027-4 underscores a broader commitment to sustainability within the salmon industry. With wild fish stocks under increasing pressure, the search for alternative sources of omega-3 fatty acids has become a priority. The GMO canola oil not only promises a steady supply of these crucial nutrients but also addresses concerns over the environmental footprint of traditional fish oil extraction. By cultivating canola that is genetically tailored to mimic the benefits of fish oil, Norway is stepping boldly into a future where aquaculture leans heavily on innovation and responsible resource management.
Controversy and Concerns
Despite the clear environmental and economic incentives, the introduction of GMO canola oil has not been without its detractors. Critics point to the use of glufosinate, a herbicide banned in several jurisdictions, in the cultivation of NS-B50027-4. There are also broader concerns about the environmental impact of genetically modified organisms, including potential risks to biodiversity and the unknown long-term consequences of their introduction into the ecosystem. These apprehensions underscore the need for continued research and rigorous regulatory oversight to ensure that the benefits of GMO canola oil do not come at an unacceptable cost.
Enhancing Farmed Salmon's Nutritional Profile
The adoption of GMO canola oil is expected to significantly improve the nutritional profile of farmed salmon. Omega-3 fatty acids are vital for cardiovascular health and cognitive function in humans, making salmon an important part of a balanced diet. Moreover, the oil's ability to enhance the natural pigment of salmon meat addresses a key aesthetic concern, potentially increasing its appeal to consumers. As the salmon industry continues to grow, the introduction of GMO canola oil could play a pivotal role in ensuring that farmed salmon remains a healthy, sustainable, and attractive option for consumers around the world.
In conclusion, Norway's approval of GMO canola oil for use in salmon aquaculture represents a forward-thinking approach to the challenges facing the industry. By embracing genetically modified crops as a sustainable alternative to traditional fish oil, Norway is setting a precedent for innovation in aquaculture. However, the path forward is lined with concerns that demand careful consideration and management. As the world watches, the success of this initiative will depend not only on its environmental and economic benefits but also on its ability to address the ethical and ecological questions it raises.
